title: ifo Business Climate Index
text: start creating theme somewhat similar style ifo website. information create custom themes, see ggplot2 documentation see examples themes ggthemes package.
code: library(ggplot2)  theme_ifo <- function(...) {   theme_minimal(...) +     theme(       legend.title = element_blank(),       legend.position = "top",       plot.title = element_text(face = "bold"),       plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0, vjust = 0, size = 8, margin = margin(10, 0, 0, 0)),       panel.grid.major.y = element_line(color = "black", linewidth = 0.2),       panel.grid.major.x = element_blank(),       panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),       axis.text = element_text(color = "black"),       axis.title = element_blank(),       plot.margin = margin(10, 10, 10, 10)     ) }

title: ifo Business Climate Index
code: library(ifo)  climate <- ifo_business()  climate |>   subset(series == "index") |>   ggplot(aes(x = yearmonth, y = value, color = indicator)) +   geom_line() +   labs(     title = "ifo Business Climate Germany",     subtitle = "Seasonally adjusted",     caption = sprintf("Source: ifo Business Survey, %s.", format(max(climate$yearmonth), "%B %Y"))   ) +   scale_color_manual(     values = c(climate = "darkred", situation = "darkgrey", expectation = "darkblue"),     labels = c("ifo Business Climate", "Assessment of Business Situtation", "Business Expectation")   ) +   theme_ifo()

title: ifo Business Climate Index
code: sectors <- ifo_business("sectors") |>   subset(     series == "balance" &       sector %in% c("manufacturing", "services", "trade", "construction") &       yearmonth >= "2020-01-01"   ) |>   transform(     sector = factor(sector, levels = c("manufacturing", "services", "trade", "construction"))   )  ggplot(sectors, aes(x = yearmonth, y = value, color = indicator)) +   geom_line() +   facet_wrap(     ~sector,     labeller = labeller(       sector = c(         manufacturing = "Manufacturing",         services = "Service Sector",         trade = "Trade",         construction = "Construction"       )     )   ) +   labs(     title = "ifo Business Climate by Sector",     subtitle = "Balances, seasonally adjusted",     caption = sprintf("Source: ifo Business Survey, %s.", format(max(sectors$yearmonth), "%B %Y"))   ) +   scale_color_manual(     values = c(climate = "darkred", situation = "darkgrey", expectation = "darkblue"),     labels = c("ifo Business Climate", "Assessment of Business Situtation", "Business Expectation")   ) +   theme_ifo()

title: ifo Business Climate Index
code: climate |>   subset(select = c(yearmonth, uncertainty)) |>   na.omit() |>   ggplot(aes(x = yearmonth, y = uncertainty)) +   geom_line() +   labs(     title = "ifo Business Uncertainty Germany",     subtitle = "Original values",     caption = sprintf("Source: ifo Business Survey, %s.", format(max(climate$yearmonth), "%B %Y"))   ) +   theme_ifo()

title: Client for the Ifo Institute Time Series
text: goal ifo provide simple interface ifo institute time series data. package still early stage development API might change future. Feel free open issue suggestions.

title: Client for the Ifo Institute Time Series
text: can install released version ifo CRAN : development version GitHub :

title: Client for the Ifo Institute Time Series
code: library(ifo)  climate <- ifo_business() head(climate) #>    yearmonth uncertainty economic_expansion indicator series value #> 1 2005-01-01          NA               83.1   climate  index  92.2 #> 2 2005-02-01          NA               50.4   climate  index  92.0 #> 3 2005-03-01          NA                4.9   climate  index  90.1 #> 4 2005-04-01          NA               18.7   climate  index  89.9 #> 5 2005-05-01          NA               11.7   climate  index  89.4 #> 6 2005-06-01          NA               32.1   climate  index  89.3

what: Return ifo business climate data — ifo_business
title: Return ifo business climate data — ifo_business
text: Return ifo business climate data

title: Return ifo business climate data — ifo_business
Return ifo business climate data — ifo_business
text: https://www.ifo.de/en/ifo-time-series

title: Return ifo business climate data — ifo_business
text: type (character(1)) Defaults "germany". One : "germany": returns ifo business climate index Germany. "sectors": returns ifo business climate index different sectors. "eastern": returns ifo business climate index eastern Germany. "saxony": returns ifo business climate index Saxony. long_format (logical(1)) TRUE return data long format. applies type "germany" "sectors". Default TRUE.

title: Return ifo business climate data — ifo_business
text: data.frame() containing monthly ifo business climate time series.

title: Return ifo business climate data — ifo_business
Return ifo climate data — ifo_climate
text: Return ifo climate data

title: Return ifo climate data — ifo_climate
text: type (character(1)) Defaults "import". One : "import": returns ifo import climate. "export": returns ifo export climate. "world": returns ifo world economic climate. "euro": returns ifo world economic climate euro zone.

title: Return ifo climate data — ifo_climate
text: data.frame() containing monthly ifo climate time series.

title: Return ifo climate data — ifo_climate
text: Grimme C, Lehmann R, Nöller M (2018). “Das ifo Importklima – ein erster Frühindikator für die Prognose der deutschen Importe.” ifo Schnelldienst, 71(12), 27–32. Grimme, Christian, Lehmann, Robert, Nöller, Marvin (2021). “Forecasting imports information abroad.” Economic Modelling, 98, 109–117.

title: Return ifo expectation data — ifo_expectation
text: Return ifo expectation data

title: Return ifo expectation data — ifo_expectation
text: https://www.ifo.de/en/ifo-time-series

title: Return ifo expectation data — ifo_expectation
text: type (character(1)) Defaults "employment". One : "export": returns ifo export expectations manufacturing. "employment": returns ifo employment barometer Germany.

title: Return ifo expectation data — ifo_expectation
text: data.frame() containing monthly ifo expectation time series.
